page.title: 08St David's Harbour, Fife
page.content:
St David's Harbour is now closed and is being considered for possible housing development. It was still working up to{1983}as a breakers yard and storage dump for council road grit.
The last major breaking job it had was the{HMS Revenge}which was hit by a German freighter under the Forth Rail Bridge and sunk. It was raised and towed to St David's Harbour where it was broken up.
In former days St David's harbour was used as a coal port for exporting coal to the{Netherlands}and{Belgium}and many of Fife's roof tiles came as ballast in the coal ships. This trade ceased in 1946.
